name: Creeping Mold
oracle_text: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.
flavor_text: Mold crept over the walls and into every crevice until the gleaming white stone strained and burst.

name: Crimson Hellkite
oracle_text:
Flying
{X}, {T}: Crimson Hellkite deals X damage to target creature. Spend only red mana on X.
flavor_text: The hellkites are artists with flames, painting the world with fire.

name: Crossbow Infantry

flavor_text:
"He can split a marshfly in two from halfway across the range."
—Onean sergeant

name: Cruel Edict
flavor_text:
"No mockeries now for them; no prayers nor bells, / Nor any voice of mourning save the choirs,— / The shrill, demented choirs of wailing shells."
—Wilfred Owen, "Anthem for Doomed Youth"

name: Crypt Rats
oracle_text: {X}: Crypt Rats deals X damage to each creature and each player. Spend only black mana on X.
flavor_text:
Beware anything born among the dead.
—Tolarian saying

name: Crystal Rod
oracle_text: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

name: Curiosity
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.
flavor_text: "You know that secret? The one that wakes you up at night in a cold sweat? The one you think no one else in the world knows? Well, guess what."

name: Dakmor Lancer
oracle_text: When Dakmor Lancer enters the battlefield, destroy target nonblack creature.
flavor_text: The darkness of his shield reflects the inky blackness of his soul.

name: Dancing Scimitar
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor_text: A blade that has never known sheath, a hilt that has never known hand.

name: Daring Apprentice
oracle_text: {T}, Sacrifice Daring Apprentice: Counter target spell.
flavor_text: In front of every great wizard is a doomed apprentice.

name: Daring Apprentice
oracle_text: {T}, Sacrifice Daring Apprentice: Counter target spell.
flavor_text: "I've seen my master do this a hundred times. How hard can it be?"
